reviews.sentence: Lovely size room with comy sofa. Used it as sofa bed and it was easy to open and comfortable to sleep on but does not open as double size. Only English channels on TV found were for news but as expected as we were in different country. Because of this relied on free wi fi a lot but connection was slow and constantly cutting out. Room was good standard very clean and bathroom nice with good shower. Used room service which arrived in good time served hot food and well presentedReception staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast was excellent quality and choice and nice room to eat in. Overall slept well and was able to stay refreshed.

Excellent location. Nice hotel in an excellent location for exploring the old town. Breakfast very expensive but local shopping centre just round the comer provided a cheaper option. The hotel is located above the train station. We were not able to open a window for fresh air due to safety of being above the track which meant the room did get very hot and stuffy overnight temperature control in room did not work well. Helpful and friendly staff. Expensive onsite parking not included in room price.

Great experience. Superb location. Friendly staff. They were very helpful when I asked for 3 glasses and to open a wine bottle which I had bought from outside the hotel. Spacious rooms. Good breakfast. could not believe there was a separate toilet and a bathroom in a hotel room. A pleasant experience.

Stopover on way to the Alps. We love Anecy so thought we would have a night there on the way to a ski holiday. The hotel was good value and in a great location just 5 minutes walk into the beautiful old town. We had a family room so it felt a little cramped but that was ok for just the one night. Silly little things let the experience down. There were tiny plastic glasses and when I filled one with water it leaked everywhere. There were 4 of us and whilst it states that tea and coffee making facilities are in the room there were two disposable cups which would be suitable for an espresso and not much more and one tea bag. I would frankly rather not have anything unles it can be provided properly. The bathroom was tired and when I ran a bath there were bits of what looked like black slime coming out from around the tap area. Really unpleasant. Obviously I took the plug out immediately and it took forever for the water to drain away. The location is great bedroom ok bathroom tired but attentive staff.
Nice room but very expensive this time honestly I should say too expensive.
Excellent hotel and facilities. Really pleased with our stay last week excellent hotel and facilities and very good location. Very pleased with the breakfast too.

Very conveniently positioned. Stayed here for a one night stopover on the way to Italy. It is located directly over the railways and yet we heard almost nothing of the slow moving trains. Room had triple glazing and was a typical Novotel room perfectly adequate. Car park under the hotel was fine if tight and rather expensive at € 16 a day. Restaurant and bar were good with a limited selection but well presented and good quality. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

All good but a little expensive. We stayed here for 1 night in Superior Room a better romThe hotel is located close to the old sector beside the train station and bus station. Nearby are shops and many restaurants. There is a 300 m walk to the old town. The hotel is large but ok and nice enough. Buffet breakfast is normal but good. The staff were helpful and polite and the hotel overall was clean and tidy. I had the better Superior room with bath plus shower over the bath. The shower was good and the bath normal size. The bathroom was separate from the toilet. The room was comfortable with enough space but did n’t have air conditioning but there was a safe. The view was terrible overlook train lines but it was n’t really noisy and was quiet at night. Overall the hotel was fine but a little expensive.

Rooms need refreshing but convenient location. We stayed for two nights on a busy July week when the hotel was fairly full. The staff members we encountered were all friendly and welcoming but slightly overwhelmed with the demands on their time. The room however was to put it politely worn and tired looking. However the bed was comfortable and it was reasonably quiet most of the time ours overlooked the rail lines and some trains caused the building to shake. Fortunately it is not too busy a line at night. The bar area was pleasant and the restaurant terrace also. We do not like the new Novotel restaurant menu which is dumbed down to a choice of beefburgers a simple steak and a fish dish. Here the chef had added a few local specialities which we chose and which were good. I have mentioned before that Novotels used to be known for their restaurants but sadly this has become a thing of the past so it is much appreciated if the chef does add something more interesting to the awful fast food fare which appears to be their new standard. We went out the second night. the location of the hotel is good and there are many restaurants a short walk away. Breakfast was a real scrum most items were running out fast and tables were not cleared. The second day we avoided this chaos and walked down the road to a cafe. The car parking is secure although space can be limited. I might stay here again as the location is good but would hope they get the decorators in before then. Also Novotel do something about your awful restaurant menus.

Pleasant accommodation for our first trip to the beautiful town of Anecy. Excellent greeting and service at reception. Car parking on site was ideal. Very helpful tourist information provided in reception. Unaware that hotel was next to trainline. Appeared to run out of bacon at breakfast and no one checked the hot trays on a regular basis. Seating arrangements in breakfast room not ideal a bit jumbled.

Was good and hopefully will be again. I am an Acor Club Platinum member which means I have probably spent years in Acor hotels and I am glad to say that I have seldom needed to complain until earlier this week when I had the misfortune to spend three nights over the New Year period in a building site with a sign outside saying Novotel Anecy Centre Atria a Novotel I have stayed in a number of times in the past and was very much looking forward to a New Year break. Instead I needed to find the “ Temporary ” hotel entrance on the other side of the building from the car park entrance navigate my way through the office block corridors to the lifts to take me to the temporary reception. Although the reception staff themselves were very welcoming the hotel is in an extremely sorry state our “ Executive ” room was very tired with the furniture stained and grubby and the heating AC operated with a mind of its own I could not control it at all. My wife was very cold during our first night but by the middle of the night the heating had come on with no input from us and the room became too hot. When we checked into the room the alarm bells should have rung when I noticed that while the A C was switched on the temperature control had been set to 30 degrees and it was still cold. All of this was after negotiating three separate lifts to get from the car park to our room on the fourth floor. The hotel restaurant temporarily located in a soulless function room on the first night of our stay Dec 30th the food was very good but the service was pretty ropey. On the second night New Year ’s Eve both the food and the service were excellent but on our third night the food and service were both terrible. I think it is worth noting that the waiting staff on New Year ’s Eve was different to the other two nights much better and more efficient. In my considered opinion this hotel should close immediately not to reopen until the renovations have been completed or alternatively any on line enquiries or bookings should carry a highly visible warning that the hotel was undergoing major renovation resulting in considerable disruption to the service they can provide. A total of 693 € for three nights and three dinners for two in a building site is not good enough. In future I will be making very detailed checks on any Acor hotel I am thinking of making a reservation in.
brief Nice vacation. One night in Anecy for new year day. Good arrival always explaining main points with pic. Despite réfection of hôtel services were good just some times to wait during dinner.

Under refurbishment and supernoisy. The hotel is just located above the train station rails making the rooms shake when the trains arrived. The personal is very kid and helpful they change our room located in 2nd floor by a higher one. The hotel is also under refurbishment what makes also more uncomfortable the stay. Besides this our second room carpet was extremely dirty. I will not comeback to this hotel mainly due to the location in the train station. After refurbishment I guess it will be better but I doubt they will be able to fix the noise and shake caused by the train.

It was okay. I stayed here for 4 days and found it pretty average. The staff were nice however there was a varying level of expertise between staff members. One member tried to explain to me that the restaurant was shut however I read on my information they provided me and saw that it was actually open. Luckily another member of staff arrived just as I was about to return to my room in disappointment and explained it was as I suspected actually open. One other potential issue was that the phone in my room was broken meaning that if you wanted room service you could not get it in my room. Overall the hotel was okay and the people were nice I am not sure I would stay here again as it is quite expensive and I had to do a fair amount of haseling to get what I wanted my check in time was unusually late and I had to request extra blankets because my family was too cold. Perhaps after the renovations when the many hours of drilling stop the walls were paper thin and I could hear the drilling easily I would come back here as the experience was certainly a turbulent one.

Director of Cisco System. Entrance into the hotel is not visible from the road in Construction and no clear direction to go to the lobby and parking garage. ALso inadequate water pressure. The room is not clean.

Disappointing and hugely overpriced. We were exceedingly disappointed with the novotel anecy Centre. The pics which we saw online when we booked were of a modern and clean hotel. It transpired that the family room was in desperswned of renovation and indeed that there were renovation works ongoing with a constant banging directly above our room during the day. Furthermore the room as situated directly above the railway line. This was not clear when we booked. Not the standard I had expect having paid a considerable price for the room. We will not return.

Refurbishment well done. Nice upgrade to refurbished suite ca n’t fault it temporary restaurant served a better breakfast than the original bar was a bit sad but ok sure the hôtel will be cracking once the work is finished in next couple of months ca n’t fault the staff a bit pricey during the ski break but we will be back for sure.

Fair. The location was great city center and train station just down. The bed was nice but due to the renovation it was a mess to enter the hotel firstly then no welcoming as no real reception I guess disappointed to find out about the renovation only once we booked it.
Very difficult to check in with the car no clear way to stop. I ended up entering the parking garage as the only way to do it.

Fair. Food was good. It ’s located and built above railway tracks. My room happened to be right above the tracks so. I had a very disturbed sleep for the one night that I was there. Much better to stay in a hotel near the canals. Same price if not cheaper.

Great location functional rooms. We stayed for three nights and loved it for its great location towards the old town and the luxury of parking right there. At the moment there are still some construction work going on but as we were out all day that was fine. The rooms are clean but I found the wardrobe solution a bit small for the three of us. Even though it is build right over train tracks you hardly hear anything when a train passes. Pretty impressive We will most probably return as the location was perfect for us.

Wonderful. 1 one of the two elevators was out of order for the length of our stay 4nights. thi is unacceptable in modern times2 no ventilation in toilete3 there are no hangers or hooks in the bathroom to hang your clothes on or your towels.

Good location but still need to improve. Good location good buffet breakfast. Travel in June hot weather electricity black out on the fourth floor at midnight 0h25 til 2h30 in the morning no more air conditioning no backup lights in toilet very dark. the next day morning the corridor still no lights luckily one of the evaluator is working. Referred to the reception the next day while checkout they replied ‘ ’. yeh I heard about it ‘ ’ Not even an answer and excuse.

Very good hotel in the center of Anecy. The staff is very niceThe room is clean and the bed is very comfortableVery good breakfastConvenient location short walk to the lakeLarge spacious room. There is no play area for childrenIt would be nice if there were vegetables at breakfastWe had to code the room card 3 times a day because it did nt work very well.
Good. The third bed was not uptown standard despite charging for three people.

New renovated hotel but reservation did not go as planned. The hotel has been newly renovated. The lobby area is very inviting the rooms are new clean and functional and the hotel is in good shape. Breakfast was definitely not the best start to the day the breakfast buffet area is too small and tight and if more than 10 people are getting breakfast at the same time you will inevitably either queue or bump into other people. Furthermore one single coffee machine for the whole breakfast are is not quite enough. Our reservation was problematic. We had reserved a room for a family weekend with grandparents but for some reason our room was cancelled and no cancellation email was sent out. Only noticed this was the case then I tried to check in to the hotelrom the night before. Spent over 1 hour on the phone to the hotel and the calcenter nobody could really help me. We left to visit Anecy anyway and were lucky that one guest did not show up and we could have the room. We did not get the room type we had reserved though got half of a family room whilst we had reserved Executive. The room was very loud and the aircon did not work. Impossible to get the temperature in the room below 23 ° C room 408.

Comfortable and centrally located. Very convenient hotel in the center of town. Newly renovated and very comfortable. Great common spaces. However the parking garage is too small and it is impossible to park a car bigger than a compact car.
